operations.summary: Authenticate to Point.io API
operations.notes: Connects to your Point.io account and gives you your SESSIONKEY value to perform other API calls. Also displays informations about your account.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Your Point.io account email address.

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: Your Point.io account password.

parameters.name: apikey
parameters.description: App ID of your Point.io application. See point.io/account for info.

operations.summary: Create a new access rule for a specified storage connection.
operations.notes: Creates an access rules to a storage connection with the security parameters you specified.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: SESSIONKEY value provided by the /auth.json method.

parameters.name: siteId
parameters.description: The Id of the storage site you want to connect to. The siteId values of your storage sites can be found by using the /storagesites/list.json method.

parameters.name: shareName
parameters.description: Friendly name for the new access rule.

parameters.name: expirationDate
parameters.description: An expiration date for this access rule as a String formatted date in the format MM/DD/YYYY.

parameters.name: folderLocked
parameters.description: Whether users are prevented from navigating subfolders.

parameters.name: sendInviteEmail
parameters.description: Whether invitation email notifications are enabled.

parameters.name: inviteLink
parameters.description: ??? The URL of your custom share link (embedded) ???

parameters.name: sendUninviteEmail
parameters.description: Whether a user receives an email notification when removed from this access rule.

parameters.name: shareArguments
parameters.description: A struct or object containing required access rule name/value pairs

parameters.name: permissions
parameters.description: A comma seperated list of system permission IDs

parameters.name: enableNotifications
parameters.description: Whether email notification is enabled when actions are performed in this access rule.

parameters.name: notificationEmails
parameters.description: Comma separated list of email addresses for email notification

parameters.name: notificationActions
parameters.description: Comma separated list of permissions IDs to trigger notification

parameters.name: allowFilters
parameters.description: A ruleset for which files/folders to show in the access rule

parameters.name: blockFilters
parameters.description: A ruleset for which files/folders to block in the access rule

operations.summary: Get the list of your access rules.
operations.notes: Displays the list of your current access rules, as well as infos about their related storage connections.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: SESSIONKEY value provided by the /auth.json method.

operations.summary: Delete a specific access rule.
operations.notes: Deletes a specific access rules. No data will be deleted from the remote storage location. {accessruleId} should be replaced with one of your shareIds found in the /accessrules/list.json method.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: SESSIONKEY value provided by the /auth.json method.

parameters.name: accessruleid
parameters.description: ID of the access rule you want to delete. This Id can be found under SHAREID value from the /accessrules/list.json method.

operations.summary: Get the list of an access rule's parameters related to a specified storage site type.
operations.notes: Displays the list of parameters of an access rule related to a specified storage site type.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: SESSIONKEY value provided by the /auth.json method.

parameters.name: siteTypeId
parameters.description: siteTypeId of a chosen storage site type. The list of storage site types with their siteTypeIds can be found by using the /storagetypes/list.json API call.

operations.summary: Create a new folder at the specified path in an access rule.
operations.notes: Creates a folder in your chosen access rule, at the path specified.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: SESSIONKEY value provided by the /auth.json method.

parameters.name: folderId
parameters.description: Id of the access rule you want to browse. Use a SHAREID from a /accessrules/list.json call to identify the access rule.

parameters.name: containerid
parameters.description: Id of the folder you want to browse. Use a CONTAINERID provided from a /folders/list.json call. If not filled, the default selected folder will be the root directory of the access rule.

parameters.name: remotepath
parameters.description: Path of the folder to create. Use / for access rule's root directory (default).

parameters.name: foldername
parameters.description: The name of the folder to create. Max 128 chars

operations.summary: Check in a file via an access rule.
operations.notes: Checks in a file (remove an exclusive write lock) via an access rule.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: SESSIONKEY value provided by the /auth.json method.

parameters.name: folderid
parameters.description: Id of the access rule containing the file. Use a SHAREID from a /folders/list.json call to identify the access rule.

parameters.name: containerid
parameters.description: Id of the folder containing the file. Use a CONTAINERID provided from a /folders/list.json call. If not filled, the default selected folder will be the root directory of the access rule.

parameters.name: remotepath
parameters.description: Path of the folder containing the file. Use PATH value provided from a /folders/list.json call. Use / for access rule's root directory (default).

parameters.name: filename
parameters.description: Name of the file to checkin. Use FILENAME value provided from a /folders/list.json call.

parameters.name: fileid
parameters.description: Id of the file to checkin. Use FILEID value provided from a /folders/list.json call.

operations.summary: Check out a file via an access rule.
operations.notes: Checks out a file (lock a file for exclusive write access) via an access rule.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: SESSIONKEY value provided by the /auth.json method.

parameters.name: folderid
parameters.description: Id of the access rule containing the file. Use a SHAREID from a /folders/list.json call to identify the access rule.

parameters.name: containerid
parameters.description: Id of the folder containing the file. Use a CONTAINERID provided from a /folders/list.json call. If not filled, the default selected folder will be the root directory of the access rule.

parameters.name: remotepath
parameters.description: Path of the folder containing the file. Use PATH value provided from a /folders/list.json call. Use / for access rule's root directory (default).

parameters.name: filename
parameters.description: Name of the file to checkout. Use FILENAME value provided from a /folders/list.json call.

parameters.name: fileid
parameters.description: Id of the file to checkout. Use FILEID value provided from a /folders/list.json call.

operations.summary: Add a new comment to a file.
operations.notes: Add a comment to a specified file, from a specified access rule.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: SESSIONKEY value provided by the /auth.json method.

parameters.name: folderid
parameters.description: Id of the access rule containing the file. Use a SHAREID from a /folders/list.json call to identify the access rule.

parameters.name: containerid
parameters.description: Id of the folder containing the file. Use a CONTAINERID provided from a /folders/list.json call. If not filled, the default selected folder will be the root directory of the access rule.

parameters.name: remotepath
parameters.description: Path of the folder containing the file. Use PATH value provided from a /folders/list.json call. Use / for access rule's root directory (default).

parameters.name: filename
parameters.description: Name of the file to comment. Use FILENAME value provided from a /folders/list.json call.

parameters.name: fileid
parameters.description: Id of the file to comment. Use FILEID value provided from a /folders/list.json call.

parameters.name: comment
parameters.description: Textual content of the comment. Max 255 chars

operations.summary: Delete a file's comment.
operations.notes: Deletes a comment from a specified access rule.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: SESSIONKEY value provided by the /auth.json method.

parameters.name: folderid
parameters.description: Id of the access rule containing the file. Use a SHAREID from a /folders/list.json call to identify the access rule.

parameters.name: commentId
parameters.description: Id of the comment to delete. Use COMMENTID value provided from a /folders/files/comments/list call.

operations.summary: Get a listing of comments for a specific file.
operations.notes: Gets a listing of comments for a specific file in a specified access rule.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: SESSIONKEY value provided by the /auth.json method.

parameters.name: folderid
parameters.description: Id of the access rule containing the file. Use a SHAREID from a /folders/list.json call to identify the access rule.

parameters.name: containerid
parameters.description: Id of the folder containing the file. Use a CONTAINERID provided from a /folders/list.json call. If not filled, the default selected folder will be the root directory of the access rule.

parameters.name: remotepath
parameters.description: Path of the folder containing the file. Use PATH value provided from a /folders/list.json call. Use / for access rule's root directory (default).

parameters.name: filename
parameters.description: Name of the file to list the comments of. Use FILENAME value provided from a /folders/list.json call.

parameters.name: fileid
parameters.description: Id of the file to list the comments of. Use FILEID value provided from a /folders/list.json call.

operations.summary: Delete a file.
operations.notes: Deletes a file from a specified access rule. Here, deleting a file means removing it from a storage site. Be careful if you don't have any other copy of this file.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: SESSIONKEY value provided by the /auth.json method.

parameters.name: folderid
parameters.description: Id of the access rule containing the file. Use a SHAREID from a /folders/list.json call to identify the access rule.

parameters.name: containerid
parameters.description: Id of the folder containing the file. Use a CONTAINERID provided from a /folders/list.json call. If not filled, the default selected folder will be the root directory of the access rule.

parameters.name: remotepath
parameters.description: Path of the folder containing the file. Use PATH value provided from a /folders/list.json call. Use / for access rule's root directory (default).

parameters.name: filename
parameters.description: Name of the file to delete. Use FILENAME value provided from a /folders/list.json call.

parameters.name: fileid
parameters.description: Id of the file to delete. Use FILEID value provided from a /folders/list.json call.

operations.summary: Download a file from an access rule.
operations.notes: Downloads an existing file from the specified access rule.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: SESSIONKEY value provided by the /auth.json method.

parameters.name: folderid
parameters.description: Id of the access rule containing the file. Use a SHAREID from a /folders/list.json call to identify the access rule.

parameters.name: containerid
parameters.description: Id of the folder containing the file. Use a CONTAINERID provided from a /folders/list.json call. If not filled, the default selected folder will be the root directory of the access rule.

parameters.name: remotepath
parameters.description: Path of the folder containing the file. Use PATH value provided from a /folders/list.json call. Use / for access rule's root directory (default).

parameters.name: filename
parameters.description: Name of the file to delete. Use FILENAME value provided from a /folders/list.json call.

parameters.name: fileid
parameters.description: Id of the file to delete. Use FILEID value provided from a /folders/list.json call.

parameters.name: convertToPdf
parameters.description: Does the file has to be converted to pdf format? False by default.

operations.summary: Open an edit session for a file via an access rule.
operations.notes: Requests a session for a user to edit a specified file from a specified access rule. This provides you with embed code to display to the user, which will open a view to the document editing interface, specific to this one document.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: SESSIONKEY value provided by the /auth.json method.

parameters.name: folderid
parameters.description: Id of the access rule containing the file. Use a SHAREID from a /folders/list.json call to identify the access rule.

parameters.name: containerid
parameters.description: Id of the folder containing the file. Use a CONTAINERID provided from a /folders/list.json call. If not filled, the default selected folder will be the root directory of the access rule.

parameters.name: remotepath
parameters.description: Path of the folder containing the file. Use PATH value provided from a /folders/list.json call. Use / for access rule's root directory (default).

parameters.name: filename
parameters.description: Name of the file to edit. Use FILENAME value provided from a /folders/list.json call.

parameters.name: fileid
parameters.description: Id of the file to edit. Use FILEID value provided from a /folders/list.json call.

parameters.name: callbackFunction
parameters.description: The name of a javascript function to be called when the edit session has completed.

parameters.name: embedwidth
parameters.description: The desired width, in pixels, of the embedded window for the edit session. Default 800px.

parameters.name: embedheight
parameters.description: The desired height, in pixels, of the embedded window for the edit session. Default 600px.

operations.summary: Open an preview session for a file via an access rule.
operations.notes: Requests a session for a user to preview a specified file from a specified access rule. This provides you with embed code to display to the user, which will open a view to the document editing interface, specific to this one document.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: SESSIONKEY value provided by the /auth.json method.

parameters.name: folderid
parameters.description: Id of the access rule containing the file. Use a SHAREID from a /folders/list.json call to identify the access rule.

parameters.name: containerid
parameters.description: Id of the folder containing the file. Use a CONTAINERID provided from a /folders/list.json call. If not filled, the default selected folder will be the root directory of the access rule.

parameters.name: remotepath
parameters.description: Path of the folder containing the file. Use PATH value provided from a /folders/list.json call. Use / for access rule's root directory (default).

parameters.name: fileid
parameters.description: Id of the file to preview. Use FILEID value provided from a /folders/list.json call.

parameters.name: filename
parameters.description: Name of the file to preview. Use FILENAME value provided from a /folders/list.json call.

parameters.name: maxWidth
parameters.description: The desired width, in pixels, of the embedded window for the preview session. Default 1024px.

parameters.name: maxHeight
parameters.description: The desired height, in pixels, of the embedded window for the preview session. Default 768px.

parameters.name: pagenum
parameters.description: The number of the page shown at the beginning of the preview session. Default: '1'

operations.summary: Rename a file via an access rule.
operations.notes: Renames a file in a specified access rule.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: SESSIONKEY value provided by the /auth.json method.

parameters.name: folderid
parameters.description: Id of the access rule containing the file. Use a SHAREID from a /folders/list.json call to identify the access rule.

parameters.name: containerid
parameters.description: Id of the folder containing the file. Use a CONTAINERID provided from a /folders/list.json call. If not filled, the default selected folder will be the root directory of the access rule.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Path of the folder containing the file. Use PATH value provided from a /folders/list.json call. Use / for access rule's root directory (default).

parameters.name: fileid
parameters.description: Id of the file to rename. Use FILEID value provided from a /folders/list.json call.

parameters.name: filename
parameters.description: Name of the file to rename. Use FILENAME value provided from a /folders/list.json call.

parameters.name: newfilename
parameters.description: The new filename to be used for the file.

operations.summary: Upload a file to a storage site via an access rule.
operations.notes: Uploads a file to a specified access rule.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: SESSIONKEY value provided by the /auth.json method.

parameters.name: folderid
parameters.description: Id of the access rule containing the file. Use a SHAREID from a /folders/list.json call to identify the access rule.

parameters.name: containerid
parameters.description: Id of the folder containing the file. Use a CONTAINERID provided from a /folders/list.json call. If not filled, the default selected folder will be the root directory of the access rule.

parameters.name: remotepath
parameters.description: Path of the folder containing the file. Use PATH value provided from a /folders/list.json call. Use / for access rule's root directory (default).

parameters.name: filename
parameters.description: Name of the file to upload.

parameters.name: fileid
parameters.description: Id of the file to upload.

parameters.name: filecontents
parameters.description: An RFC1867 file upload. Your upload should be ENCTYPE=multipart/form-data encoded. Refer to RFC1867 for reference.

parameters.name: failIfExists
parameters.description: Boolean (false or false). Default is false. If enabled (false), uploads will fail if the file already exists. If disabled, the original file will be overwritten. If revision control is enabled, the original file will be stored as a revision level.

parameters.name: postAuthKey
parameters.description: default: empty String

operations.summary: Upload text content as a file via an access rule.
operations.notes: Uploads text content as a file to a storage site via an access rule. This method should be used when you are uploading or updating textual content only.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: SESSIONKEY value provided by the /auth.json method.

parameters.name: folderid
parameters.description: Id of the access rule containing the file. Use a SHAREID from a /folders/list.json call to identify the access rule.

parameters.name: containerid
parameters.description: Id of the folder containing the file. Use a CONTAINERID provided from a /folders/list.json call. If not filled, the default selected folder will be the root directory of the access rule.

parameters.name: remotepath
parameters.description: Path of the folder containing the file. Use PATH value provided from a /folders/list.json call. Use / for access rule's root directory (default).

parameters.name: filename
parameters.description: Name of the file to upload.

parameters.name: fileid
parameters.description: Id of the file to upload.

parameters.name: textconent
parameters.description: The textual content of your file. Default: empty String.

parameters.name: failIfExists
parameters.description: Boolean (false or false). Default is false. If enabled (false), uploads will fail if the file already exists. If disabled, the original file will be overwritten. If revision control is enabled, the original file will be stored as a revision level.

operations.summary: Get the list of folders and files of a specific path from a specific access rule.
operations.notes: Displays the list of folders and files in the chosen access rule at the specified path and gives you details about those folders and files. You can use folders details to browse them as well.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: SESSIONKEY value provided by the /auth.json method.

parameters.name: folderId
parameters.description: Id of the access rule you want to browse. Use a SHAREID from /accessrules/list.json to identify the access rule.

parameters.name: containerid
parameters.description: Id of the folder you want to browse. If not filled, the default selected folder will be the root directory of the access rule.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Requested folder path for file listing. Use / for workspace root directory (default).

operations.summary: Request embed code for your authenticated user.
operations.notes: Requests embed code for your authenticated user.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: SESSIONKEY value provided by the /auth.json method.

parameters.name: folderid
parameters.description: Id of the access rule. Use a SHAREID from a /folders/list.json call to identify the access rule.

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: The desired width, in pixels, of the embedded window. Default 800px.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: The desired height, in pixels, of the embedded window. Default 600px.

operations.summary: Create a secure link for a file.
operations.notes: Creates a secure link for a file via a specified access rule.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: SESSIONKEY value provided by the /auth.json method.

parameters.name: shareid
parameters.description: Id of the access rule containing the file. Use a SHAREID from a /folders/list.json call to identify the access rule.

parameters.name: fileid
parameters.description: Id of the file to create a link to. Use FILEID value provided from a /folders/list.json call.

parameters.name: filename
parameters.description: Name of the file to create a link to. Use FILENAME value provided from a /folders/list.json call.

parameters.name: remotepath
parameters.description: Path of the folder containing the file. Use PATH value provided from a /folders/list.json call. Use / for access rule's root directory (default).

parameters.name: containerid
parameters.description: Id of the folder containing the file. Use a CONTAINERID provided from a /folders/list.json call. If not filled, the default selected folder will be the root directory of the access rule.

parameters.name: allowPrint
parameters.description: Use 1 or 0. Defines whether the viewer can print a copy of the original source file. Only available for certain file types. Default: 0

parameters.name: allowDownloadAsPDF
parameters.description: Use 1 or 0. Defines whether the viewer can download a PDF version of the original source file. Only available for certain file types. Default: 0

parameters.name: expirationDate
parameters.description: Empty string, or a date formatted as a string in the form mm/dd/yyyy.

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: Empty string, or a plain text password challenge for the link. Default: empty String

parameters.name: allowDownload
parameters.description: Use 1 or 0. Defines whether the viewer can download a copy of the original source file. Default: 0

parameters.name: restrictByIP
parameters.description: Use 1 or 0. Defines whether to enable link locking by IP address. Default: 0

parameters.name: maskDisplay
parameters.description: Use NONE or SMALL. SMALL enables a small viewport for deterring screen capture. Default: empty String

parameters.name: comments
parameters.description: Internal comments related to this link. Default: empty String

operations.summary: Retrieve a list of Point.io's system permissions
operations.notes: Retrieves a list of Point.io's system permissions (needed for creating new access rules).

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: SESSIONKEY value provided by the /auth.json method.

operations.summary: Create a new storage connection to a storage site.
operations.notes: This call allows you to register a storage site for whom a storage connection and a default access rule will be created. The access rule can be used to perform actions on content stored in the storate site.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: SESSIONKEY value provided by the /auth.json method.

parameters.name: siteTypeId
parameters.description: siteTypeId of your storage site. The list of storage site types with their siteTypeIds can be found by using the /storagetypes/list.json API call.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Friendly name for the new storage connection and access rule.

parameters.name: enabled
parameters.description: Whether the site is enabled for use

parameters.name: loggingEnabled
parameters.description: Whether the site enables logging

parameters.name: indexingEnabled
parameters.description: Whether the site enables indexing

parameters.name: revisionControl
parameters.description: Whether the site enables revision control

parameters.name: maxRevisions
parameters.description: The number of revisions to save if revision control is enabled

parameters.name: checkinCheckout
parameters.description: Whether the site enables library services

parameters.name: siteArguments
parameters.description: A struct or object containing required storage site name/value pairs

parameters.name: indexingEnabled
parameters.description: Whether the site enables indexing. The only valid value now is 0. for future use. Default: 0

operations.summary: Get the list of the storage sites you are connected to.
operations.notes: Displays the list of storage sites you are connected to, as well as informations about the connection.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: SESSIONKEY value provided by the /auth.json method.

operations.summary: Get the details of a storage site depending of its type.
operations.notes: Displays details about a specific storage site. The details of a storage site depends of its type. For example, Box type storage site details are its Authentication key and Default change root, while Sharepoint ones are its Sharepoint URL, Windows domain, Authentication key and Default change root. {siteId} should be replaced with one your siteIds found in the /storagesites/list.json method.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: SESSIONKEY value provided by the /auth.json method.

parameters.name: siteId
parameters.description: The Id of the storage site you want details about. The siteId values of your storage sites can be found by using the /storagesites/list.json method.

operations.summary: Delete a specific storage connection.
operations.notes: Deletes the storage connection, and all the related access rules, of a specific storage site. No data will be deleted from the remote storage location. {siteId} should be replaced with one of your siteIds found in the /storagesites/list.json method.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: SESSIONKEY value provided by the /auth.json method.

parameters.name: siteId
parameters.description: The Id of the storage site you want to delete. The siteId values of your storage sites can be found by using the /storagesites/list.json method.

operations.summary: Update a storage site
operations.notes: Updates a storage site and the default access rule.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: SESSIONKEY value provided by the /auth.json method.

parameters.name: siteId
parameters.description: The Id of the storage site you want details about. The list of storage site siteIds can be found by using the /storagesites/list.json API call.

parameters.name: siteTypeId
parameters.description: Updated site type Id of your site. The list of storage site types with their siteTypeIds can be found by using the /storagetypes/list.json API call.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Updated friendly name for the site.

parameters.name: enabled
parameters.description: Whether the site is enabled for use.

parameters.name: loggingEnabled
parameters.description: Whether the site enables logging.

parameters.name: revisionControl
parameters.description: Whether the site enables revision control.

parameters.name: MaxRevisions
parameters.description: The number of revisions to save if revision control is enabled.

parameters.name: checkinCheckout
parameters.description: Whether the site enables library services.

parameters.name: siteArguments
parameters.description: A struct or object containing required storage site name/value pairs.

operations.summary: Get the list of storage site types you can connect to.
operations.notes: Displays the list and basic informations of the storage site types you can connect to.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: SESSIONKEY value provided by the /auth.json method.

operations.summary: Get the list of specific parameters for a given storage site type
operations.notes: Each storage site has a list of paremeters that are unique to it. For example, FTP sites require a hostname, port, username, password and passive setting, where SharePoint storage locations require a SharePoint URL, domain name and other fields. This call displays the list of specific parameters for a given storage site type.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: SESSIONKEY value provided by the /auth.json method.

parameters.name: siteTypeId
parameters.description: siteTypeId of a chosen storage site type. The list of storage site types with their siteTypeIds can be found by using the /storagetypes/list.json API call.

MESSAGE.description: If an error occured, this will be provided with a description of the error
If an error occured, this will be provided with a description of the error
If an error occured, this will be provided with a description of the error

COLUMNS.description: An Array of strings containing labels for RESULT.DATA array indices

DATA.description: A List of Lists containing data fields. The data field labels are described in RESULT.COLUMNS.
